review: The salad was good but a few housekeeping issues. 1) how do you put a glass directly in the ice bins to pick up the ice. Don't you know the glass can break.   2) you should not get soda from the fountain with your personal water bottles  3) and you should not drink soda at the fountain

I wish I could give zero stars, but Yelp is too nice. My boyfriend got food poisoning from his meal that he could barely finish 1/3 of, THERE WAS A DAMNED COCKROACH ON THE WALL WHERE MY SEAT WAS, you have to scream to have a conversation at your table, and it took twenty minutes for our waiter to deliver an overpriced Miller Lite. This place is disgusting.  I apologize to the person whose boneless wing I touched yet was re-delivered to the correct table, I was a bit tipsy and didn't realize that even happened until writing this review.

We very often have coupons for Fridays and sometimes a free sandwich just seems more appealing than turning on the stove in an 80 degree apartment.  The vibe on a Thursday at 6:15 was weird to say the least. There was a DJ playing LOUD music inside and the two of us were seated at a giant booth nearby.  I got the southwest chicken salad. It was fine, but I think I could've made a better one at home. The service was slow and the music was too loud to carry on a conversation (wow, I really am getting old).  All-in-all, I was thoroughly unimpressed. We had attempted to go to this location once before to sit outside on the roof deck for some drinks and were told the roof deck was closed (at 7 PM on a Saturday) so we went elsewhere.  Take your business to a higher quality, local business.

This place used to be one of my favorite restaurants, but not anymore. We came into the restaurant and perhaps because we were sat by the window, a server didn't appear to our table for a half hour and that was after we inquired as to whether or not we even had a server. Once the server came, she was friendly and apologetic, we gave our food and drink orders. It took another half hour to get our drinks (refillable tea, which was never refilled) and another fifteen minutes after that for us to receive our food. Once we did it was hot and tasted pretty good. My son ordered endless appetizers, but had to wait about 20 minutes for each order to be filled. After the second refill, he was annoyed, as were we all and we found someone to give us the bill, paid it and left. Sorry TFI FRIDAYS on the Parkway, we won't be back!!!

It's just what you would expect from a TGI Friday's. It's over priced and the service is sub par. But the ability to go to a restaurant inside a hotel is a huge plus for most travelers. I would think this is one of the only reasons this location is still open.

What a joke this place is!  Since we were still in a bit of a late lunch cheesesteak coma we decided to have a light dinner at the hotel restaurant.  We arrived and were told that there was a 15 minute wait....even though there were a number of open tables.  They said that those tables were for 21 and over people, and we had our 8 year old twins with us.  Okay, I guess I cannot argue with that, so we waited. 15 minutes or so later they called our name and put us in the booth at the other end of the joint.  We sat there for 15 minutes and no one came to greet us or even take a drink order.  Finally I decided that we would take our business elsewhere but wanted to let a manager know.  When we were walking our we asked to have a manager come.  After 5 minutes of waiting we started walking out when a man appeared from the upstairs.  He asked what the issue was, so I told him that we had waited without even being acknowledged.  He said that he would be happy to discount our order if we stayed.  I told him that I was not interested in that after the experience I had and would be letting corporate know.  He said "Thank you" as we walked away. This place should be shut down or switched to another chain.  Don't waste your money or time here!

I spent a bit at the rooftop bar and enjoyed the concept. The drink I received was strong however the cup wasn't filled all the way up. The music was also way too loud for there not being a lot of people there it was weird. The food was as expected everyone enjoyed with little complaints. We did tell the server it was my birthday and he seemed to forget. When he did remember he congratulated my brother. The busser dragged two high chairs loudly across the room. Along with complaining about his job while cleaning the table next to us. Overall. I wouldn't go back or recommend unless you were just going to the rooftop.

Honestly contrary to popular belief, TGI Fridays on the Parkway gets hella lit.  I work on 16th and Arch and the rooftop in the summer time is the place to be for Friday night happy hour at our company.  Their specials are amazing and the view of the city from the patio is unbeatable. The bartenders on the patio are so nice and make the $5 long island iced teas v strong.  They also have $5 select appetizers on special as well.   We came with a huge party of 25 on Friday paying with American Express company gift cards and they were so accommodating.  They even set the patio up earlier than 5 pm for our party...shout out to Stacey and Stephanie! I totally recommend this spot for happy hour on the patio when the weather is nice.

I'm staying at the Sheraton down the block and I was hungry so I went there around 10 pm on Friday. The restaurant seemed more like a night club as in you go there to pre game before you go out. It was extremely small, a dj was playing old school music which i loved and the service wasn't all that bad. It had a very free spirit vibe and though I do like that, there were young girls nearly naked there. Problem is, there were young children there as well. If they want to turn it into a club then make it 21 yrs or older after a certain time. I don't even think the girls half dressed were 21. It made me uncomfortable. Food came out pretty quick. Everything tasted good. If you want a peaceful dinner then this isnt the place for you. If you want to turn up, go for it.

This place sucked for customer service.waited 25 minutes for drinks and 45 to get just appetizers.Had not received anything.2 of our group of 4 left with getting food.They paid for their drinks and left.No way am I coming back.Place was not that crowded that a few drinks an appetizers could be served in a timely manner. Very unacceptable

One of the worst experiences I have gone through. I do NOT Recommend this place to anyone.  First off the staff has no coordination.  They told me and my wife we were placed 2nd on some "list"  They then went on to let others ahead of us.  Once I asked the server why we weren't placed in our table because we were 2nd. She goes to say the table we had ready for us was unavailable  due to the server NOT wanting to work. I'm sorry. It's your job.  She then went on to say we were in the wrong and had to wait even more after letting others ahead of us. Instead of offering us an apology she kept debaiting she was inthe right and asked us to wait even longer with a nasty attitude. I didn't realize costumer service wasn't a priority.  How are we placed 2nd but get pushed back to dead last after waiting for over 40 + min.  This is ridiculous.  Stay away from this place.  And to management. Your server smelled like marijuana.   Maybe you should also start drug tests to your lazy incompetent employees.
Steep prices, a bar staff that doesn't pour consistent drinks, high prices for what you get. It was the only option in the hotel. We were better off to walk 5 mins.

I came here for the ayce appetiZers. It wasn't too bad. It was worth the money. The service was good. I came here around 9 on a sat. It was really crowded. I was told there was more than an hour, but I could sit at the bar as soon as a spot was available. That only took like 5 mins. I wound up getting the garlic boneless wings. They were ok, and so were the fried pickles. I got the meatballs which were overly salty. It was filling too. The potato skins were way too dry. I don't recommend those at all. I liked the mozzarella sticks and the potstickers. Those were good  when they said endless they meant it. I ate until I was stuffed. I might be back to try their flatbread and bbq wings.
Just waited over an hour for food at  and still didn't get my food. And waited for the manager who never showed after 10 minutes. The Ben Franklin Pkwy location is quite the establishment.

zero stars. This place is TERRIBLE. easily the worse Friday's I've been to. The food was not seasoned. My kids complained about the burger buns that were so soggy they couldn't eat them. The breakfast buffet was not good. Terrible. The employees are g to the o...they service the hotel next door where I stayed. I don't know who brokered that deal or why Embassy is still even entangled with them. The Friday's part of the trip (room Service and free breakfast) made the trip a terrible ...horrible ...disgusting ....forgettable ...trip. This place is the absolute worst. You have choices...don't ...don't ....don't eat here. Embassy is ok but their unfortunate entanglement with Friday's made this a terrible experience.
STAY AWAY! this place was disgusting. Staff was super rude and had us waiting for over an hour. The staff all have nasty attitudes and they smelled like weed. Would not recommend AT ALL!

We went after a long day of waking in the city.  We were starving and wanted something kid friendly for our 2 year old.  He was tired, hungry and cranky.  We were first told it would take 20 minutes to be seated and then seated right away.  There were tons of seats upstairs, so not sure why they told us 20 minutes..  It then took 10 minutes before we saw a server.  She took our order and said she'd rush the milk and food for our 2 year old and again we didn't see her for another 20 minutes or so.  The people beside us got their drinks before us and they sat down way after us.   The food was ok.  The restaurant was sorely outdated.  This service leaves much to be desired.  Never going back there.. so many better options in Philly.  We were just desperate.  I'm surprised Embassy Suites and TGI Friday's allow this restaurant to operate in this manner..

Lord, No! The bartender made the wrong drink, the waitress brought the wrong salad, and the burger was cooked dry.  It's way to loud and the service was slow.  Go several blocks south - much better options.
Service was slow and unorganized, staff wasn't very pleasant and the people there was a rough bunch. Stay clear

The restaurant is run by high school teenage kids. Really bad service. It's super dirty. Especially the restrooms! The food was disgusting. The manager is part of the problem. He's just as lazy as the rest of the staff standing around. The place is just a bad experience ready to happen.

Sadly lacking for a Friday's. It is dated and tattered - even the menu was badly stained and literally falling apart. I am sure it was great when it was new, unfortunately that was many, many years ago. The server was fine and the food was very average. The experience was better avoided.

Showed up before 9pm.  Manager finally came over at 9 to take drink orders and food.  We did not receive drinks until 9:30. Food finally came at 9:45.  Place was not busy.  Fries tasted like they sat for a long time before we got them. Extremely slow service for a Monday night when the place had very few other diners.

Extremely slow service I don't recommend anyone to come here especially for the endless apps because you'll be waiting forever to get them. I had to wait for my ice to melt to get my refill on a drink

Worst dining experience of my life. Got seated at around 8, everyone got drinks around 8:45 (we ordered waters and 1 tea), then everyone eventually got food around 9:30. I think we saw our waitress 3 times in the total 3 hours we were there when we were her only table. Most of us ordered Endless Apps and waited so long to get them that our server eventually decided to just ring in random items and bring them to our table when they got out. Even when we got all of those items, still everyone didn't have food. Our waitress tried to blame everyone else for the delay and even argued with as after asking if we got everything and we informed her that we didn't. When I eventually got my food after an hour and a half of waiting, I asked for blue cheese for my wings. Sharday (our waitress) never returned. Meanwhile there were about five servers sitting at a booth nearby for our entire dinner and no one ever came to check in on us. Sharday was taking over an hour now to get back to the table and it was almost 11pm, we wanted to dine and dash it was so long. I'm sure the other servers heard us talking about it, by this point we were pretty much the only table in the place. No one came over. Eventually, one of us had to go over to the group of servers and ask for our checks. They all started asking "Yeah where IS Sharday??" as if they hadn't noticed she'd been gone for over an hour. Finally she came with our checks and after 20 minutes of ringing up our checks, we finally got out of that horrible establishment. Do not ever go here.
There was a BUG in my food enough said. Then the manger proceeded to tell me I still had to pay for my meal.The service was slow.  I would never come here. Go to a different Fridays.
The food took forever to come and it was cold. The waitress didn't accommodate us for the wait or the cold food and some of the orders were wrong. Disappointment.

Came in, waited for 45 minutes for a table for two, only to have a waiter ask what our registered name was again. Apparently we were forgotten. Sat down after we went and pointed at three unoccupied tables and asked why we were not seated yet, they realized and gave us one of the tables immediately. We asked for the Endless Apps offer, but were told that we were too late as it ends at 11! We came in early, but because TGIF decided to hire a bunch of unprofessional employees who know nothing about hospitality and waiting, it gets a lot of negative ratings because EVERYONE has a bad experience in it. The place needs total rehiring of thr staff and some serious management. This is business, not a highschool cafeteria. Night ruined.
Service was very bad Monday can in at 220 not busy did see server till 246 didn't get food till 320 endless apps my as endless if you want to say for 24hrs

Incredibly slow service . They admitted that food was sitting under warming lamps .. and this was 15 minutes prior to getting our food . We also were seated during the Final 4 and not one of the 4 tvs in our area were playing the broadcast . When we asked for it to be switched on they said they would happily change them and never did .  I would recommend highly looking at an upgrade in the area as there was much to be desired from this restaurant and they continued to disappoint.

So disappointing!   Ordered to go on my first day here because room service (which they provide for the hotel) was going to take too long.  Food wasn't ready when promised.  I ordered the Jack Daniel's Chicken, it was dry and flavorless. Thought maybe it's just because it was to go, so thought I'd try again but eat in the restaurant.  Ordered a half rack of ribs, over cooked and dry.  Never again!!!!
Worst TGIF ever! Service was horrible and drink specials are only at the bar even though we were sitting at a table in the bar area. Will never go back.

Tried to order take-out, was put on hold for 6 minutes. Hung up and called back thinking they just forgot about me and was subsequently put on hold again. 10 mins later I hang up and call back just to complain and they just put me on hold...again...?!? As I'm holding I go on chilis website and order what I wanted. Then I try to wait for someone to take me off hold at Friday's so I can once again complain but they never take me off hold. So I hung up and call for a 4th time just to tell them the good news that I ordered from chilis!

This place is old looking, needs to be remodeled & cleaned. They seat u in a stupid order. The workers look dirty , like they just got out of bed & came to work. The bathroom was horrible. The baby changing table looked so dirty like it hasnt been cleaned ever. They really fell off here smh

I normally love TGI Friday's but upon my arrival it was clear that the service was not going to be like experiences in the past. The greeter had a bad attitude and a face that matched. Once I was seated it took more than 15 minutes for the waiter to come to our table. There were only about two other family's in the restaurant so there was no apparent reason for the waiter to see my table. Not only was the service sub par but the cleanliness was not the best. Not the best experience I've had but I'm willing to give it another chance

Horrible experience. The waitress was obviously overwhelmed to have a larger party to serve and wanted to only serve half of us at a time which did not make any sense. I ordered a alcoholic drink and it tasted like they poured fruit punch in a glass and that was it. They were unable to make a casear salad properly. The silverware was dirty to top it off. By the time I did get my meal I didn't even want it. Just overall it was a miserable experience and if it weren't for the great people I had at my table I would have walked out.

Stopped in for dinner before a concert at the cathedral.  Told the server we only had an hour.  Took 10 minutes to get out drinks and then over 30 minutes to get or food.  Told them to take it back.  No apology or anything from the manager.  Won't be back.
Doesn't even deserve one star. We got here when it wasn't busy at all and the drinks came out late and the food took an hour. Absolutely ridiculous. They weren't all that friendly either.
The sodium content on almost every item was higher than anyone ahould eat in an entire day. We ordered the lowest sodium item on the menu and it was still uneatable.

I was in the mood for a Friday's meal so I went in and only stayed 2 minutes before I left. The acoustics in that restaurant are so horrible that it hurt my ears to sit in there. The only noise was from the people in the restaurant.  You would think that a national chain would have this figured out.  I ended up in a pub next door with live music and it was half as loud. Yeesh

Came here with my wife and three kids. We waited 20 minutes for the drinks, and even when they came, they only brought 2 out of the 5, and one was the wrong drink. Then we had to wait an additional 40 minutes for the food.  Don't waste your time or money. Go elsewhere.

I'm not really a fan of chain restaurants.... but we just got to Philly, it's right next door to our hotel and my guys are hungry.... so drinks and burgers it is.  We were seated pretty quickly, but it took a while for the waitress to take our order. It was a simple order.... nachos for an appetizer....  a couple of drinks..... and a couple of burgers. 10.... 20.... 30 minutes passed.... and then someone else brought the burgers (before the drinks and nachos). We asked why and after more time passed the waitress came by and brought one (!!!!) glass of water for three of us and said our drinks didn't come yet because the bartender was missing (huh???). She later came back with one drink saying that the other, my wine (while on the menu) wasn't "in season" (huh????). Our nachos were brought for dessert.... sprinkled with obvious table salt. And, the glass of water I requested to help choke them down may or may not have been spit in. Stay away!!!!!!

Came to this location on a Monday early evening. We were seated at a table where I had to move chairs out of my way in order to sit. Sat down for over 5 mins and a server never even showed their face. So my friend and I stood up and decided to sit at the bar. As we were walking to the bar one guy thought we were leaving and I told him no we were moving to the bar. He says "o she's your server", my response "well she took too long to come to the table. So we're going to the bar". Never asked or showed any concern. Whatever. No one needs a pity party. But I can see why this location is always empty. The service is very poor. With that said, when we sat at the bar. The bartender (James) was quick and attentive. Of course I look to the side bar and there they are. A bunch of employees huddled in a corner at a table chit chatting away. Idiots... very poorly managed place.  As for the food... Eh! This place has become more fast food. Better off at McDonald's.
Ordered a medium steak with broccoli and sweet potato fries- was served a cool rare steak with cold blood drenched fries and cold dry broccoli with a splash of blood. Yum!

Slow, freezing, waited an hour to be seated and when we got in there were empty tables everywhere. Asked multiple times to adjust the A/C but the hostess didn't try to get it adjusted. Still sitting here waiting for our food.

I wouldn't come to this location again. During seating we had a waitress who started to take our orders then half way through another waitress started taking our ordering. We were confused. And we hadn't received anything we ordered from the original waitress. Then we ask who is the waitress and where is our food and drinks she tells us the other woman was just in training. Like ok but why didn't she bring our food? She's like oh you guys could have told me. Umm we weren't aware that she was in training and you were our actual waitress like what type of stuff is that? They should let ppl know someone is in training and then they shouldn't mid way through ordering leave and another waitress take over without our knowledge it was very confusing. I also didn't appreciate that there is hardly any vegetarian or Pescetarian type foods. I wanted sizzling salmon and shrimp and they said they couldn't substitute it. I mean the salmon meals were $20 alone and sizzling chicken and shrimp was $17 idk why salmon with shrimp was $26. That's a total rip off. I also was told from the waitress in training that I couldn't get Cajun pasta with extra shrimp since I couldn't eat chicken and then the actual waitress said I could. Horrible dinner experience.

The single worst meal I have ever had. The slop they put in front of me was inedible. I asked the bartender what he recommended and he said, "The Sizzling Chicken and Shrimp is the best thing on the menu." When it was presented to me, I could not believe the tiny size of the shrimp.  I took a bite of the chicken and had to spit it out. It did not taste like chicken. It was unpalatable. Never ever again will I ever step foot in any TGI Friday's. I am still holding back the urge to vomit from this experience. Not to mention...the obnoxious crowd in this place.  The people there were yelling and carrying on with no sense of consideration for others. Cursing and foul language from this awful crowd made the experience worse than any I've ever encountered in any city anywhere on this Earth. A nightmare.

I was at the hotel next door and after reading the reviews decided to do a take-out. The food was ready on time, the entree and dessert were packed separately. The staff were pleasant when I went for pick up. The food was pretty good (grilled salmon with steamed broccoli) and a very good value compared to the same food via room service. If I stay at the same hotel I will do another take-out from TGIF!

DO NOT EVER COME HERE - I just had the worst service of my life. I could understand if the place was mobbed with rowdy customers during a sporting event they were playing and the service was lacking. That was not the case tonight. There were open tables, drinks took forever to get to the table and when they did - they had to be the WORST drinks I ever had. How ironic that this establishment markets "THEE Friday's Ultimate Margarita" and it was the worst drink I have ever had made for me outside of my undergrad days drinking mystery drinks during my collegiate rugby years. I chugged beer out of my mate's rugby cleat and this was still worse. I came here because my daughter is a picky eater and it was late, and for some reason she loves Fridays. The waiter did not bring waters for ANY of us. We ordered wings and asked for plates so we could share. Never came. He passed by twice and we politely reminded him - still nothing. It just kept getting worse from that point on and I could drone on forever about how much worse it got but I'll sum it up. Even the server said sorry but had no reason or excuse for his shitty service. Feeling sorry is nice and all but it doesn't excuse you for sucking at your job. On top of that, there were about 4 uniformed people who worked there walking up and down the aisle as if they were checking up on things but didn't do anything. Definitely not short staffed, just lazy. I am in the Army and I know what shamming out looks like. This place wreaked of it. I can't believe I even paid for my sorry excuse for a meal.  Do yourself a favor and go ANYWHERE ELSE. Hopefully it will go out of business and become a parking lot...or even abandoned lot - it would be a better use of space. An ABANDONED LOT would be a better use of space. Yours truly, Giancarlo

Read most of the bad reviews before going in but thought we'd give it a shot because I was craving Friday's veggie burger! The place did not smell good and we asked for a seat near the windows. There were two empty tables by the windows but the server said we can't use those 'coz 'the waiter who serves that table was having the day off!' (Hmm!) So she took us upstairs - which was entirely empty. While she was walking us up and down, she was talking into her mic and headset asking about seats (as if we are at a large hall with thousands of people that she needed the mic and headset throughout that journey!) She even said we can only use a particular table upstairs, so we said we'd rather sit downstairs. Back downstairs. There was a couple that was leaving their table and we asked her if we could use that one. She said ok but that we'd have to wait 15 minutes for them to "prepare the table" (hmm) so we thought ok maybe we can wait. We were looking at the TV while waiting - there was a political show on and we thought we might as well wait standing if it's going to take 15 minutes for them to clean the table, but the waiter came back and said we would have to wait in the lobby area outside and that we "cannot wait while standing." That was it. We went out without even telling them we were leaving. But who knows, maybe they are still cleaning that table or waiting for that table's waiter to come back from vacation. Worst service for a place that leans toward being pricey.

Our experience at this location on July 3rd was hands down the poorest service and experience we'd ever had at any TGI Friday's.  We should've had an idea of what was to come immediately upon entering the door. We followed 2 other parties in, and the hostess had a terrible time explaining that we couldn't head right upstairs to the roof patio but rather had to wait for each party to be seated individually downstairs. The wait wasn't an issue when it came to getting seated, but it was a very discombobulated situation in terms of understanding what we needed to do (which was wait downstairs and then be retrieved by the hostess per group as she went up and down the stairs).  Once we were seated, no one came to ask us what we wanted to drink. We were parched and in pretty bad need of water. 10 minutes, 20 minutes, 30 minutes...we finally grabbed a random waitress walking by and asked for service. She went and found us someone inside who said that apparently the other server had left and no one had replaced her at her tables (great).  So, we put in our drink orders and ordered our food at the same time. Another 30 minutes passed. NO DRINKS, NO FOOD OR APPS. We grabbed the other server again as she walked by who seemed appalled that we STILL hadn't gotten our drinks. (Note: the roof patio wasn't even busy - only maybe 2 or 3 other parties were out there.) Over an hour of waiting later, the drinks finally showed up, but we never did get the pitcher of water that we asked for when placing our order. Our alcoholic beverages didn't come until even later. But we had our water - FINALLY - after asking for it numerous times.  Onto the food...our boneless wings were NOT boneless. I personally ate a wing and felt a huge crunch, spitting out a mouthful with a 1 in (maybe bigger) piece of bone. Yuck. There was also a long piece of hair on that plate that I pulled out and tossed onto the ground.    My husband ordered Jack Daniels flat iron steak and got the steak with no Jack Daniels sauce. He sat around waiting for the sauce (which was supposed to be ON the steak to begin with) for about 10 minutes. It was clear our server was frustrated with the kitchen because our food was taking so incredibly long and coming out incorrect.  We did tell her to inform the kitchen of some of these issues, but we didn't get approached by management or have any adjustments to our bill. We didn't ask directly to speak with management but given all of the problems we were dealing with and alerting them of, you would think management would've been informed.  Our take away from this experience? Next time we'll ask for a manager...and next time, we won't be choosing TGI Friday's for lunch.

I went to this location on a Sunday around 1:00 pm, and it was pretty quiet. Not too noisy, but also pretty chill. My server was Quiana and she was really nice. She always checked in to see if I needed anything, and for that, I was satisfied with her customer service.  I had a coupon for a free appetizer, so I had the mozzarella sticks with marinara sauce, which were really good. For my lunch, I had a Jack Daniel's burger with french fries. Man, when I tell you it was delicious, I must say that burger tasted awesome. It was very juicy and well done. I had no complaints. I looked at the previous reviews on Yelp and was shocked to see that so many people disapproved of this location. I think this location is a good choice on a day where there aren't a lot of customers. I was served my food 20 minutes from when I came into the restaurant, and I was satisfied with the service.

Normaly i love TGI Fridays!! But this one in Philly was so sad! we ordered on 8PM two Coctails, one Lemonade and two Menues! The Coctails came on 8:20PM, my glas had Lipgloss on it! a new one came 15min later!!! the Lemonade came never! The food was not warm and i ask for Mayo, they never came! i am sad about this visit, because normaly TGIF its good!

The service was horrible.  Took them over 20 minutes to make my drink.  Salad and bread sticks didn't come out together.  We had to ask several waiters and the manager for my drink.  Waiter had to ask several times what we ordered.  Had a little chat with the manager.  Luckily they credited our meals.  Still left a tip for the waiter.  I told my wife I don't blame the waiter, I blame the company and it's staff for not training him properly.

A local college area Friday's in deed. Louder than the family neighborhood Friday's. But that was expected.' This sits next to the Philadelphia Embassy Suites. So very convenient if ever staying there. Menu had a few different items on it. The cocktails are stiffer. And the strawberry lemonade is on the money. Three people in my party agreed on the strawberry lemonade.  I just had the New York Cheddar and Bacon burger med well. Very well cooked burger. Very juicy and med well as I requested. . Aside from the above normal noise this was a good visit.  Warning if you venture here. Make sure you bring a jacket. This location seem to like it at 60 degrees. Because it's very cold in this building.
Don't waste your time coming here unless you are wanting the slowest and poorest service ever!

OMG This Fridays is just as bad as the others. The seating time was a good hour. The male hostess was so caught up looking at girls, he didnt call our name. Once seated I had a dirty table and the waitress told us the kitchen was slow. AFTER WE JUST WAITED AN HOUR TO EAT HERE? Finally me and my guest were overcharged on the bill. When we brought it our waitresses attention, she tried to argue with us then realized she overcharged us. Never coming here again.

Worst ever!! Sat for 16 minutes before I ever got a drink. Ordered water and a glass of wine. The water never showed and the wine glass had lipstick on it. Food took 32 minutes on a Thursday night and not even busy.

If your a hungry traveler looking for a meal. Do not head to TGI Fridays on a late Night. Meals look great,but you'll soon be deceive by its presentation. Food and drinks were incorrect. Expect at this time to eat something cold,and In a rush. Sad to say,your better off at Apple  Bee's
Service was excellent & the bartender Marie was AWESOME!!! She makes great long islands and has a smile that'll brighten anyone's day!!! Thanx Friday's!!!!!

Service sucked... Was here after the marathon... They weren't even that busy. Not sure why the chose to have only one bartender there if its the day of the marathon.. She barely looked at us, and had to flag her down to get our FIRST drink and our food.. When the food decided to arrive, we were given no utensils or plates.. We had to literally reach behind the bar to grab plastic utensils!!!  WTH...

This place is where Embassy serves their free breakfast each morning. Its actually pretty awful. The food was so mediocre which I suppose I can expect for free food, however its also a mad house in there. We literally had to ask them to set up tables outside because there were no more left inside and no one to even attend to the messy tables that others have gotten up out of. Its unorganized and very disappointing.
This was the WORST experience I've had dining out in a long time. The steak was horrible, the replacement food was cold, service was extremely slow, and no manager in sight.

Listen out of towners who stay at the hotel adjacent to the establishment: welcome to philly. no u wont get the same waitstaff ud get in a denny's in virginia, its not open late till 2am like nyc, the food aint amazing like it is in (insert yummy food city)... this is philly. the foods ok, its open at decent hours when normal people eat, the server isnt running around trying to make everyone happy... despite popular belief, this is not the city of brotherly love. we do what we can to get by. so stop complaining about how terrible it is. its a chain... what more do you really expect from this place?

Worst food and bad service. Had fried shrimp where the batter wasn't cooked through and cold inside. NOT the fault of the waitstaff who are working hard and friendly, but management hasn't hired enough people. Do not go here.

I'm going to be honest - the only reason I go to this TGI Friday's is for the roofdeck. Is the food average? Yes. It's a chain. Are the drinks basic? Absolutely. But on a nice late afternoon for happy hour, I really enjoy sitting upstairs here. It's usually never overly crowded, the music is decent, they open the outside bar, and you get a nice view of the area without breathing in SEPTA fumes. I'm kind of glad so many people have given this spot a "never going to come here again." so that I can continue to have this patio to myself.

Stopped in Friday's, with a friend,  for a quick bite to eat. It was around 4:00 p.m. on 9/27/13. I asked the employee who sat customers were there any tables by the window which looks out onto the Parkway. She said, "No...we only have one." Thought that was EXTREMELY weird; we only needed one table. THAT should have been the sign for us to leave. She sat us at the one table by the window. Good.  I ordered a cocktail, my guest ordered water. Waitress returns with water for both of us - no cocktail. We sat 30 minutes no food, no cocktail. She did stop by and told me the bartender was working on my drink. Fifteen minutes later she came with drink but glass was dirty. I asked her to cancel the drink. Guest got his food after waiting nearly an hour - I waited a little longer. When she did bring my dish it was the wrong item.  In the many years I've eaten out, I have NEVER experience this type of inadequacy. I can laugh now as I think about the buffoonery of it all. Why didn't we pick up and leave? Our time was limited and we had to eat. I can safely write here, I would never visit this establishment again. Free coupons could not get me to go back.

I must say I came here they other day and I was VERY disappointed. The services wasn't so great and the food was just okay. I'm usually not a harsh critique but I wasn't feeling anything about it. Would not recommended going here

They always are updating their menus and offers to bring in more people, but the thing is: their food always disappointed. This is the place you should order wings, moz sticks, chix fingers and hamburgers. OH - and a side order of their awesome Jack Daniels sauce. You should definitely go and partake in their 3 dishes for 13.99. It's worth it.
It's a chain. I never expect much coming here or any place similar, and I was right.

We live in one of the residencial apartment nearby, and the MUSIC from TGI Friday on each Thursday and Friday night is no noisy! I seriously wanted to call police for that issue many time. They should realize that they are located in the center of many hotels and please concern about others!

Friendly and accommodating staff-- managed to find a place for our group of 6 without much fuss. Everyone in our group was happy with our food, and the service was good. Only complaint was the noise-- some event was going on upstairs, and it was LOUD!

I've been to Friday's restaurants in various locations and this is one place I wish I had skipped.  We went here solely on the recommendation at our hotel just down the road.  We should have gone to Subway across the street. They were not terribly busy, but the long wait to get in on a Wednesday night was due to the fact they just don't pay attention to the patrons.   We were told our wait would be 20 minutes but it was well over 30 minutes.  We waited, like everybody else has mentioned, longer than necessary to get our water we requested.  It was another interminable wait for our waitress to come back to take our order.  Of the four orders, two were correct.  We ate it anyway and I made a mental note to make sure our bill reflected the food we were served and not the food we ordered.   While we were waiting for our food, a patron was leaving the restaurant but was unable to navigate the stairs to get back to street level.  There is a wheelchair lift she planned to use.  One employee locked her in it and left her.  I'm not sure why she left, but that poor woman was left there for 15 minutes.  Not only did I feel sorry for her having to stand for that long when it was clear she was uncomfortable but how humiliating!   Our waitress knew a group of people who came in while we were eating.  If I thought we were ignored before, I am not sure how to describe how ignored we were after her friends came in.  She took my credit card for the bill and walked over to visit with them.  It was 10 minutes of visiting before she left them to run my card.  In that time, I was trying to pool enough cash at the table so I could leave that and walk over to her to ask for my card back.  Sadly, we were short $6. On top of the horrible service and mediocre food, the music was unbearably loud.  We were not seated at the bar, either. Save your time, money and hearing--go somewhere else.  Even Doritos from a convenience store would be preferable to this.

I have never been a fan but i've went because friends & family like them.the one on city line's food is good & that's it,,,this one on the parkway is the worst! I do not.like the up-stairs because it stunk,it was dirty,I cleaned the table  myself,because they took to long to do it! My food was not done and it tasted horrible,the waitress was nice but I believe onky because she was new other wise her attitude would have been just like the rest,I will never ever let anyone talk me into going back there!

I was recently here while waiting for transportation to a wedding from the connected hotel and was not impressed. The bar had very few customers yet it took over 10 minutes to order our drinks and then a long time to get our bill. The only reason to go here would be its connected to a decent hotel. I hopefully won't be back .

Stopped in an afternoon on a January weekday and was sat immediately. Kevin Z. was a highly attentive server, constantly refilling our drinks, checking on us regularly and was patient as we took our time trying to figure out what to eat.  Afterwards he suggested the Vanilla Cheesecake and it was great. Food was the same as any other Friday's but the service was great and the prices much more reasonable then NYC.
generally an okay restaurant and atmosphere, convenient to art museum.
I went here when I was a freshman in High School after Aids Walk. Let me tell you, 9 fucking dollars for a hamburger is not worth it.

I hate to rag on places but I really wouldn't recommend this place.  We were a large group, about 20 people.  Something was just off.  I don't know if it was the service, I don't know if the kitchen was behind, I just don't know.  We asked to split checks and ordered as small groups despite a long table.  My group of 4 ordered and we waited forever to get drinks.  We had to ask where they were.  The group next to us ordered chips and dip.  When it came out, they said they RAN OUT OF PLATES and gave them a whole bunch of napkins.  Weird.  One woman in our party was a nursing mother. We asked the waiter if they could bring our her entree first since the baby was fussy and she was most likely going to leave.  The waiter responded by saying they were working on the appetizers.  He could have just been nicer or more professional.  When our entrees came out, they brought 3 of the 4.  We waited and then asked where the 4th one was.  They said THEY ONLY HAVE TWO SAUTE PANS and his entree would be out shortly.  Again, just weird.  The food is the food.  Its a TGI Friday's.  If we weren't such a large group, I would have gone anywhere else but a chain in Philly.

My wife and i ate here, last night, (Saturday evening). while we were staying at a nearby hotel for a convention.  It was one of the worst experiences we have ever had.  1)  The food was just barely acceptable; 2) we both started with soup, but the waitress gave us teaspoons to use to eat the soup.  When we got her attention to ask for soup spoons, she told us they were all dirty and needed to be washed and all they had were the teaspoons; 2)  They were very disorganized as to who got what meal. An employee holding two meals came to our table and asked it they were ours - and they weren't even close.  He didn't seem to find the right table anywhere near ours.  Hopefully, he found went before it got cold.  3)  When the waitress who took our order came with our food, my order was correct, but what they brought for my wife was someone else's order, so she had to bring it back and get the correct order,  4)  During the dinner, my wife needed to use the restroom and she asked the host where it was and he directed her to it. It was a single unit unisex restroom and, while my wife was in the restroom, a man walked it.  Apparently, the lock on the door did not work!  When my wife went back and told the host the lock was broken, he responded by telling her that they knew it was broken and were telling people - however he didn't tell my wife when he told her where the restroom was located.  5)  We were in eye sight of 3 other tables and each of the tables seemed to have something go wrong: misdelivery of food or, as to one table, something so wrong with the food that they took it away and, what appeared to be a manager, came, and it appeared that he apologized to the couple.  If we ever get back to that part of Philadelphia, rest assured we will never go back to this restaurant.

This Friday's could use some help-BAD!  But since I actually like Friday's food and drinks and this is my closest location, I come here occasionally. I'll start with the good: Top food/drink faves: -Captain Morgan Caribbean Chicken sandwich--grilled chicken breast topped with pico, sour cream, avocado, and captain morgan sauce--so yummy -Spinach Dip -Wings (even though I'm not a huge "wing" girl....all of their varieties have been good when I snatched a few from a friend's plate) -Brownie Obsession-- A WARM brownie topped with vanilla ice cream, carmel, fudge, and nuts.  This is my favorite dessert hands down at ANY restaurant!  And I love that my favorite dessert is available in 50 states-SCORE! (Note:  If the brownie is not warm enough this dessert is just not the same.  Must be straight out of the oven---well probably microwave :-/) Drinks:  Margaritas and Long Islands are good cheap staples here.  But if you want to kick it up a notch...go for the Patron Cosmo Rita (A cosmo mixed with a margarita---it works and packs a punch-trust me!).  I also tried their new drink called the Twisted Gimlet which is delicious--Ciroc, with agave nectar and fresh lime, shaken and poured straight up Now for the Bad. -Such a flithy establishment!  Do the bus boys EVER mop the floor? -Customer Service---not horrible, they just all have a nonchalant attitude.  What happened to people taking pride in their work?!? -Atmosphere--nothing special here.  ***Note to the Fridays Corporation:  Please mark this location high on your list for a renovation!******  I swear this must be the last Fridays in the country who has yet to undergo the Fridays renovation.  I felt like I was in an old Bennigans or something.   With these changes, this Fridays has the potential to be stellar, because it's a good location and the food is not too shabby.  There is no reason for this restaurant with its prime location in center city to be like this.  No Excuse!!

Absolutely terrible. I went here with my boyfriend for the endless apps. It took them forever to even ask what we wanted to drink. The waitress never even introduced herself and was very rude. When the food came out it was undercooked and made our stomachs hurt immediately. My boyfriends drink was watered down and terrible. It ended up being almost 40 dollars for the worst service and food I've ever experience. I will never go here again.

absoluely horrible service! Our waitress, Meadow would be much better suited for fast food than actually waiting on customers. When asked what craft beers they had, she said "Bud light". We have two young sons and ordered lemonade for both, she brings one, sets it down and walks away. When she came back we asked for the 2nd lemonade she says "oh you wanted two?" yeah genius. She went in search of a pen, took our order without writing anything down. Naturally it came out wrong. I ordered the sizzling chicken, it came out burnt and dry. After driving 10 hours with 4 kids, I just picked around it, ready to get everyone settled for the night.

My best friend and I have been coming to this Friday's for the past 5 years, every 3 months or so. Love it! We work late nights during football season and when we get done work, we'll stop by here and have a nice relaxing dinner. We also came here on the day of the mummers parade with my daughter. it was a blast. great service, and great food. the location is perfect for sitting back and watching the day unfold.

Terribly slow.  Asked to have steak cooked medium and blackened - got charged and very well done. Brought wife's dinner full 20 mins before delivering anything to me. No water refill.  Terrible. Choose someplace else

Stopped by for a late night dinner with the GF.  Service was pretty lackadaisical - very slow to take our orders initially, but eventually they took care of our needs - the waitress and her trainee were friendly at least.  We both got the 2 for $12 deal.  Green Bean Fries  These were nicely fried and the green beans actually weren't mush. The horseradish sauce was nice.  Spinach Florentine Flatbread These were dreadful. Limp, moist, no texture at all. Almost bland. Chicken Fingers These came well fried and were huge and plentiful. The accompanying fries were seasoned with S/P and were decent. Cheeseburger At a joint like this - they won't be asking for the temp of your burger. Expect it cooked well. Still - they create a nice char. Two slices of American cheese. Decent - but nothing to write home about. Fries were OK.  Overall - a filling meal and affordable. But nothing great. There are much better options out there in Philly.
The service there is always mixed. Could be really good, could be really bad. However, the food is always good and the location as well as the actual place is pretty nice.

So I tried again for a late dinner during the week. We were seated...and then...well...nothing? So after 15min you go to the bar to ask someone to come. She finally came. "I'm so sorry blablabla", we ordered beers and food. Wait 15 more minutes...nothing. Bye! INADMISSIBLE !!!!

Went in expecting a nice casual dinner but the experience ended up souring our stomachs.  Restaurant was cold in the beginning of nov., took forever to get our drinks, the waiter was unavailable most of the time (his name was Charles), and there was paper in one of our drinks. we had to get up and ask for extra sauce, the check, and the salad had cheese in it which we specifically asked to be omitted because of allergies.  no concern whatsoever.  instead of ensuring we had a good meal, all the staff seemed to be chating in the corner. tried to express our concerns with the manager but he acted as if we were in court trying to plead our case until i asked for his name and he gave us a 15 dollar certificate. Definitely avoid this Friday's. it will only cause you headache.

There was a time when I thought Friday's was more special. That time has passed. Like many chains, it's let go of quality and raised it's prices. Even at a reasonable price, it's not really worth it. I don't get how they stay in business. Sure, you can get an okay burger or other type of sandwich with some fries. They have some decent apps. But all are way over priced. It's just not worth it.

I'm late with this review but a couple weeks back I came here for lunch with a friend and it was my very FIRST time eating at Fridays! I ordered the Spicy Shrimp and Chicken Alfredo and it was delicious up until I was almost finished the dish I discovered a damn Hair in my food. I was so pissed off because I was almost finished with the dish! They offered me another but I declined I asked to speak with a manager to inform them that I was not paying for that and I was highly upset that I had ate most of it only to find a hair in my food. I will not be eating at that Fridays again or any for a while!
The bar area has the worst customer service ever. They are extremely under staffed and very slow.

I mean, it's TGI Friday's. Would I eat here if I ever had to pay? No way. But if someone else is paying (long story) then it's fine. Service is friendly, but the burgers are pretty gross. I had the turkey burger and would not recommend it. The Jack Sesame Chicken Strips appetizer, on the other hand, is delish. I recommend heading over on a Tuesday, when it's $5. Get that and a $8 pick 2 lunch with another person and you'll be in and out for a great price. But there are tons of options nearby that are much, much better. So only go here if there's some really, really compelling reason.
This was for the hotel's complimentary breakfast. It was very tasty and had a nice assortment of breakfast foods. Good coffee considering it comes out of a machine.

Came into the city a little early before my meeting. thought that I would get a bite to eat. I had to sit and wait 30 minutes just for my appetizer to come out and when they finally did it was the wrong thing in the food was cold. And the waitress took my food to the wrong table twice.. #not happy

Worst TGI Fridays ever!! Took forever to receive our beverages, even though only 2 other parties were there. We ordered an appetizer and we were charged twice for it. I used my stripes points to pay for both of our meals and we were told that because we used the points, they could not correct the bill to remove the extra charge for the appetizer. We were also charged for endless appetizers when we specifically told the waiter we didn't want that option. The waiter was extremely polite but the manager was a complete jerk. The manager told us if we didn't agree with the bill, not to pay the waiter and just pay the bill. It wasn't the waiter's fault! Why should we punish him?! We will be filing a complaint to the company directly. It ruined our entire evening.

Ok its ice cold in there its the second week of October and they have the a/c cranked like its July I know why restaurants do this but really my food was well prepared just lukewarm I blame that on my MIA waiter who had the nerve to circle 20% on the suggested gratuity poor waitstaff poor ambiance probably my last time coming in this location

Waiting for a bottle of wine for 1 hour 15 minutes. Been here since 7:30, it's now 9:20 and still no appetizer. Avoid like a bad habit.  Music too loud, too dark and the manager had a bad attitude. I had a party of 10. Won't get my business again. Had to rate it or could not continue. I say minus 2 stars.

I work in the service industry and this place doesn't do any justice to the downtown area. There's so many other places where the service is fast, friendly, and clean. This place isn't any of them. We got a brand new waitress, who was left on her own, that served us dirty drink glasses and royally screwed our order. She didn't even take the order is what amazed me! I'll stick to my small owned restaurants and pubs.

My husband and I went in there on a Saturday around 2pm because I really needed to use the bathroom, being that I'm 20 weeks pregnant. The place is very small, so I suggested to my husband that we just take a seat at the bar as to not take up a booth because we knew we wouldn't be there too long. As I walked in, one of the waitresses made a comment about me being pregnant. I didn't hear her, so I just smiled and walked up the steps. My husband proceeded to the bar as I turned around to ask where the restrooms were. Another (friendly) staff member gave me directions. On my way back inside the same woman who made a comment before stops me and makes yet another comment. "You going places you shouldn't even be going" with a smile on her face. I didn't even get a chance to order a drink for her to have some kind of reason to think that I would be drinking while pregnant. (Which even if anyone was, I agree is wrong but is still not her place to comment.) I told her just because I'm there doesn't mean I'm drinking nor that I don't belong there. I felt extremely uncomfortable and judged by her comment. I do everything to have a healthy pregnancy and here comes this ignorant lady assuming because I walk into this establishment that I'm a crummy mother. I sucked down my water quickly and my husband his beer and left.  I will never be back there.

Seriously bad hostesses was confused did not  have a clue on what the function of the position as a hostess.   Order the sizzling chicken and shrimp.  The chicken breast were the size of a chicken nuggets.  Dry  taste of the chicken breast.  Strongly recommend to avoid this place even if you are staying at the hotel Co joining the restaurant.   Avoid service really is bad. Look for other surrounding places to eat.

the food is kinda boring unloess u get something way too unhealthy...but one time i got some spicy shrimp from the heathy section that were pretty good. i go here sometimes to visit my boyfriends brother who is a server. the one thing i think is worth recomending is the roof deck. it has a great view! just go for some drinks and enjoy it!

We came here merely to dodged the rain but decided to stay and have lunch. The greeter looks bored and gave us the look as if we are merely just wasting his time. Our appetizer was yum but a bit burnt. My boyfriend's chicken bruschetta was too garlicky for his taste and mines. I like my sizzling steak however the potato wedges that came with it was brunt .. badly. These 2 stars are mainly for our server who was very friendly and stopped by every 10 minute to see if we need anything else.
the service here is okay.  the food isn't that great at this friday's.

I hate to be this person but this is by far the worst experience I have EVER had. I sat at the bar where there was four other people and it took 15 minutes to get a drink. When I got my drink (a margarita on the rocks) it was all triple sec. I took ONE sip and was absolutely disgusted. Next, when I got the food I ordered there was a piece of the brush in the food. The bartender explained it was a brush and not hair and did not even call a manager over.. Okay? It gets worse I order a water and there was a piece of food in it. As a bartender you should RECOGNIZE things like this and not ignore. I was so disgusted by this awful experience that I decided to leave.. Of course it took another 15 minutes to do something as easy as swipe a card. Legit had to beg someone to close us out. TERRIBLE. Mc Donald's would have been a better experience. The place is a HELL HOLE.

I never thought I'd be writing a review for TGI Friday's but here I am, oh the tangled webs we weave. My manager is retiring after 32 years and anytime someone leaves the company we have a happy hour, very original. Usually it's at Tir Na Nog or Con Murphy's and I'm not really a fan of either but when it was announced that it was at Friday's I REALLY wasn't a fan of that idea but oh well, in 60 years when I'm ready to retire I'll be able to choose my own place (hopefully BRU will still be around). We arrived at 4:00 and went up to the rooftop bar. Who knew they had a rooftop bar?! Happy hour specials don't start until 5:00 but the bartender said let's just start it at 4:00, who cares. I like this guy. More and more people from work began filing in but there was plenty of room and the bartenders helped us pull tables together. The reggae playing over the speakers had everyone feeling irie and as time went on I looked around and everyone was having a fantastic time.  I don't know if it was the perfect storm of a great group of people, cheap drinks, awesome bartenders, unbelievable weather, and Bob Marley, or if TGI Friday's is a legit happy hour spot but either way I had a blast.

We planned to go here for fun. Chains are pretty good sometimes and are like regular restaurants, but distinctly more amusing. We were seated by a girl in over-the-knee socks and a miniskirt. That is the last time anyone paid us any mind. And that part is funny too. After we waited and waited, no one came to greet us at our table or take drink orders. We realized we'd rather spend our time and money enjoying ourselves and our food! So we left. It was the complete TGI Friday's experience! Including leaving before we are served and choosing another restaurant. Avoid this process and just do a little Yelping first. I'm sure any of the other restaurants along the parkway are good.
I went here with my gf at 5pm. It was packed, but we were seated promptly and had awesome service from a waitress named cherry. We received our food after 10 minutes! It was great overall.

I should of read the reviews!   I so regretted it.  Restaurant is right next door to hotel and it was raining so we figured how bad could it be, right?  Service was horrendous, food was good but ended up getting my drink way after eating our dinner..even though I ordered way ahead of it.  Had to go to the bar to get more water and soda for my little one.   Save your money and order take out.

The last time I had gone to TGI's was probably about 15 years ago...and now I see why. There's nothing special about it. The food was ok but I've had better elsewhere. We ordered off of the deal part of the menu and we were overcharged on our bill. We explained to the server that she overcharged us...she had told us how the deal worked but she had told us incorrectly and therefore we were overcharged a LOT for our meals.  There are other great options out there, use em.

This place is obviously on the decline.   The food is adequate, nothing mind blowing.  I think the cooks have no clue how to time a table at all, as our table took seemingly too long to get our food, and my wife's burger was ice cold. They weren't packed, but they obviously had at least 5 or 6 wait staff/greeters with nothing better than to stand on the door and gossip and block people from coming in and out. They need to fire almost everyone and start over...I don't see them getting any better.

Wow, how can you be that bad? Well this Spanish looking guy walked up to us with a dirty black t-shirt, dirty baggy pants that was low, dirty shoes, and scruffy. How the hell do you tell us your our server when you look like that!! The bartender had no teeth. How the hell are you bartending?? I thought appearance was the most important thing in the industry but apparently not at this location. I will never come back here again. The fries was horrible. How do you mess up on that. It shows one star but that's a negative star. They need to clean up this place. Oh the host didn't show any sense of urgency as she saw me and my family staking by the front. This place sucks!!

Alright... so let me preface this review by the fact that I have given this place multiple attempts, as I often stay at the Embassy Suites above it for business and this place doubles as a hotel restaurant as well as a standalone place. This means it is the only place I had access to without going outside, so I've probably visited here about 5 times.  The food is what it is - it is a chain, the food comes in pre-packaged, its pretty hard to have a variable experience with regards to the food at a TGI Friday's. What earns it the one star is everything else about the experience. As others have mentioned, the service is terrible, particularly at the bar. The bartenders (I think one is the manager) is more concerned with making wildly inappropriate comments to some "regulars" than serving anyone else (I'm a young dude, I usually don't get bothered by this stuff, but I've sat there being ignored for 10 minutes due to this banter). The beers are outrageously overpriced... though some happy hour specials are fantastic.  The nail in the coffin is the cleanliness... the last time i visited there, I had a shopping bag on the ground next to me at the bar, and the guy next to me was kind enough to point out that a cockroach was about to crawl in it. Wasn't all that surprising given that the place smells like its been cleaned the absolute minimum amount possible to check off the closing checklist every night for the last 10 years.

I hate to break to this TGI fridays but the service is ridiculously slow even though there wasn't that many customers. I have eaten their Korean steak taco serve with rice jasmine. the steak doesn't taste very Korean and it has no taste in to it.

I wouldn't normally eat at a chain restaurant when there are so many great local joints close by but apparently no one serves food past 10pm on week days. I was forced to grab a late dinner here.. The restaurant area was not busy but the bar was almost full. The hostess told me if I wanted a to go order I would have to order from the bartender (the only busy person in the building) I waited 15 minutes to get his attention (meanwhile I was searching yelp for somewhere else to go... No luck) it took over 30 mins to get my SALAD (after I already waited 15 mins to order). As I waited I watched several parties leave due to lack of service and almost all the bar patrons needed attention- new drinks, food orders, etc. After reading the previous reviews everyone seems to have the same complaint, lack of service. Working in the service industry myself, I really can't believe no one cares? Where is the manager? Where is corporate? Disappointing because there is not a lack of traffic.
I stopped in here for dinner one night. Let's just say I wish I had not. The food was so, so. The service was very slow.  I like TGI Friday's. I think I'll skip this one next time.
Super slow service. I waited 23mins flagging down every server who passed by begging them to wait on me and bring me some water.
Slowest service ever! The server brought my children's food a full 15 mins before bringing out mine. Then I got charged for my children's drinks which were included in the kid's meal price.

It's attached to the hotel, so if you're staying at the Embassy, you're kinda stuck going here unless you wanna grab a cab.  They stay busy, which I understand, but the service was pretty crappy.  Our server's visits to our table were few and far between, and dinner here involved a lot of forgotten condiments, take out boxes, refills, and other things we requested.    The food was fine, standard as you'd find at any Friday's or chain spot.

The bartender Diamond is outgoing and attentive. Friday's has a special menu for food and drinks, which is offered throughout the week. The loaded potato skins are dry and the sesame jack chicken strips were pretty good but too crispy for me.

We were seated, but never served. The decor is original from 20 years ago. The table next to us had a rubber band in their mashed potatoes, and that was their second meal sheet the first one was incorrect too. We left, told the hostess, who seemed unphased by our statement of not being attended to. The manger who was sending to the other table needed a shirt 3 sizes larger, very difficult to look at, especially at a restaurant.

I more than like this Fridays based solely on the accomendating manager Dawn Process, she is a sweetheart! She went above and beyond to serve us during a busy time of the day. The drinks (cosmos and LI ice tea) were indeed well made by bartenders Mike and brooklyn girl Stephanie. BTW the appys were delish and garnished so nicely! I just can't get enough of that Jack Daniels sauce!  Don't hesitate to try this TGIF's because it's worth the trip!
The food is awesome.  The atmosphere can be better.  It always seems to be extra cold and the waiters could use a class or two on customer service.

Visited this location due to staying at a nearby hotel.  The wait was about 30 minutes and we were seated upstairs.  After about 15 minutes, James, came up and took our orders.  Restrooms were filthy like a truck stop or abandoned rest area. The food was mediocre and the service was lackluster at best.  As soon as our food came out, we asked for our check and boxes.  I couldn't stand being in that place much longer.  Do yourself a favor and go to Wawa for a sub and not waste your money on this place.   HQ if you are reading, do the public a favor and hire people who want to work at this location.

NO!!  I went because my friends were already going there, and I could not convince them otherwise even though I tried really hard. I'm not a fan of going to chains in Philadelphia, because there are so many other great bars to go to, but I wanted to hang out with my friends so I sucked it up.  It was last night (Friday) for Happy Hour. And their Happy Hour specials sound good: 1/2 off aps, and $4 margaritas, $2.75 Miller Cans. But that's where the pluses for this place end!   They have an outdoor deck with a DJ. the music was WAY TOO LOUD for a Friday evening at 5:30 and for the size of the deck. It was also horrible music, and no one was dancing, which made me wonder why it was that loud in the first place.  The bartenders where not polite. When I ordered my beer he put it in a red Solo cup instead of just giving me the can. He tried to tell me that this was classier then a can. Neither Solo Cups or cans of beer are classy, but I seriously felt I was at a Frat Party walking around with a red cup.  I was done once I saw other customers drinking there beer with straws in the cans like it was soda.  The bathrooms were dirty, the food was ehh and the service was unimpressive. They really need to turn the music down on the deck, and clean up the roof top deck a bit.

Let me just say that I really try not to go to chain restaurants... especially ones like T.G.I. Friday's.  They usually have very limited vegetarian options, the food isn't that good anyway, and they're just flat out lame.  I don't think I need to expand on this.  Everyone already knows it. I went to this T.G.I. Friday's because a co-worker gave me a buy 1 entree get 1 free coupon and I was coincidentally going to be in the neighborhood that very night, so my boyfriend and I went.  We did wind up having dinner for 2 for $10, which is sweet.   It was bad, though.  The waitstaff was neglegent.  We were seated right next to the kitchen, so there was a lot of traffic next to us, and we could overhear the conversation in the kitchen, which included many expletives.  I'm all for expletives, but not when I'm on the job and potentially within earshot of customers.  The food was mediocre, which was to be expected, I suppose.   There's just no need to go to mediocre restaurants, especially when you live in the city, and there are 10 restaurants on every block.   Unless I come accross another significant coupon, I will most definitely never go to T.G.I. Friday's again.  Essentially, you'd have to pay me to go back.

Yes, yes.  I sometimes eat at Friday's.  I have a good excuse - it's attached to the hotel where I stay when in Philadelphia.  Sometimes all you want after a long-ass day at work is to get into your jammies and order chicken finger room service.   Occasionally I GO DOWN to the restaurant and order, but only if I'm feeling brave.  The place is full of loons, both employees and customers.

A TGI Fridays that resmbles a pub. That was my first thought entering this place. Had the Jack Daniels chicken with brocolli and baked beans.  I will say, the food was good but as Ludacriss said "where the f*ck is the waitress at with my drink". The service was really slow. Food took awhile, drinks took awhile, we never got a refill or offered and it doesn't seem that busy here. Would of gave 4 stars if the service wasn't slow. Waiting for the waiter is like waiting for the New Jersey Nets to win a game.

the food is great. it only get three stars though because the staff isnt to great. Servers are mediocre some rude.  Ive had a few bad experience when the waitress was rude, i got seated at a table when i requested a booth. This location is ok but improvements are needed!

Fridays used to be my spot! But, after my experience at this location, I haven't been since. The main problem is that they are a franchise, so they do things a little bit different. What completely turned me off, was that they had a DJ next to the bar! WTF! I couldn't hear my self think. If I wanted to hear a DJ, I would have gone to old city or a real happy hour.  I had to move upstairs, which was empty, but I just waited 20 mins.  They didn't even have the TV's on. I am sitting watching Music Choice pics.  Service is ok, depending on who serves you.  City Line's Fridays is no better.  So basically, if you want a typical Fridays experience, forget about it.  Forget about it in Philly!

Some of the worst waitstaff I've ever experienced in this place out of all the numerous times I've eaten here. The food is sub par and the service is often ruff around the edges. If your looking for a good meal and a nice time eat somewhere else.

Okay, I know it's chain and maybe that doesn't make it "cool." So it's not a secret yet to be discovered. It's right on the very beaten path. But, the food is consistent and their drink menu is so darn fun!

It is what it is. Just fine, but absolutely nothing great. I wish that they would better utilize that awesome roof deck they have with a view of the parkway and city hall. But they don't. We showed up at 9pm on a Sunday and they were no longer seating people out there. And it's really the only reason we went in the first place. So sad.
In the pile of calories served to me I found a few surprises: unexpected ham, rubber advocado, and a jar of mayo. So if that's your thing. Enjoy.

We recently went here for a work happy hour.  What a joke this place is.  First we got yelled at by the staff because happy hour doesn't start on the roof deck until 5pm.  Ok whatever, but your menu says happy hour from 4-7 pm.  So, um that makes no sense.  Next, happy hour drink specials are very limited.  2.75 for bud, that's the only beer special.  We paid 5.75 for a miller lite bottle and 6.50 for red's apple ale bottle.  This during happy hour?  All the other bars along the parkway offer specials on beer for happy hour.  This fridays has to go, it's so gross walking through it, very dirty.  The only reason they are still in business is because of the roof deck and proximity to hotels.  There are much better places to go in the city for outdoor summer happy hour with much better drink specials.  TGI Fridays on the parkway is such a rip off. Avoid this place if you are in the city for business, pleasure or whatever.

The Philly restaurants have spoiled me with good service and food, so when my friend said she wanted to meet here, I winced.  I figured I would give it a chance... but I should have gone with my gut.  The service was just terrible... there was practically no one there and our waiter was nowhere to be seen when we needed or ever asked for something.  I waited almost 15 minutes for the Jack Daniel sauce for my Jack Daniel Burger. And then my burger was burnt! Just avoid.
the service was suck we asking  individual bill the server just put in one bill the server never come to my table to take dirty plate and asking is it everything ok they just busy with superball,

I would never go back here again. A couple of years ago after an average breakfast, I slipped and falled on some wet stairs within their establishment.  I ended up in the ER of a local hospital.  When I complained to the Manager later, they blew me off and said something had been done about it.  Like what?  They had put up some yellow cones but their roof still had a leak  and was dripping water. Verdict?  Forget about T.G.I. Fridays.

INFESTED WITH COCKROACHES. Scene:  I'm sitting at the bar. Just ordered the 3 course meal deal, enjoying a beer. The place is fairly busy. The bartender walks away after taking my order. THen from behind the counter crawls a brownish red cockroach the size of jumbo pack of Juicyfruit. At first I am startled (I HATE BUGS) and then it crawls right up to me. I immediately throw my drink down, grab my jacket and get the bartender's attention. I inform her that i will not be dining here tonight and that i am going to be sick. She inquires why, and i reveal the fetid creature under my glass and say "I can't tolerate this'.  She seems unsurprised by the bug's presence and says "okay", as if it were a common thing to happen here.  AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE. ZERO STARS. THIS PLACE IS FUCKING DISGUSTING.
I also agree with Misha.  This place is HOOD.  The sizzling Chicken was delicious though.  There are too many good places to eat in Philadelphia, do not consider going here.

Terrible!  This Friday's was attached to my hotel.  After a show at the Spectrum a friend and I were hoping to catch a bite.  It was around 12:40am   They close at 1am.   The door was already locked.  WTF???? Why close so early on a Friday night?  The hotel was packed due to the Phillies hosting the World Series and Pearl Jam playing the Spectrum and a lot of people were trying to get inside.... Oh well its their lostt revenue :)

The food was good and the service was great we only waited 30 min for our table which was good considering it was the 4th of July and the restaurant was in the center of all the 4th events.  My bf and i sat down got drinks ordered and ate and paid all in 45 min that's my kind of service.  Also anyone who likes Fridays i definitely suggest getting the strips card i have had it for a couple months and i have already gotten 3 coupons for a buy 1 get 1 free dinner and a free app coupon when i signed up so its definitely and a great place to go for great for at great prices.

The service was horrible. The food was okay, not sure if it was worth more than half of what I paid for though. The server delivered my sandwich without all the stuff it is supposed to come with.  My drink was empty when I got my food and I had to wait 15 minutes before I saw her again to ask for a refill (again) and get everything I was supposed to get with the sandwich. By that time though the bread was all soggy and my food was just cold and greasy. On top of that, it didn't really seem like she was busy. It just seemed like she didn't care enought to even try and give decent service. I guess she doesn't know her income is dependent on providing decent service.  I've worked in several restaurants before and know what you are supposed to do.  1. You check the food to make sure it is what they ordered before you serve it. 2. You check back with the customer 3 minutes after you serve the food to make sure they have everything  and are happy. 3. You make sure they have something to drink when you serve the food or soon after. 4. You don't disappear for 15 minute chunks of time. Try to keep it to 5 and ask for help if you get too busy to do any of the above in a timely manner.

The only reason this place gets any stars is because it was the only place open at 11pm. EVERYTHING closes so frickin' early in this town. The server was so cool. we loved him...a fellow student.  He is also the reason this place got any stars.  The food was terrible. If you want a real money maker in philly- open a late night pizza joint.
